faq.title: Frequently asked
faq.subtitle: Everything you need to know about online sick leave certificates
faq.notFound: Didn't find the answer to your question?

items.question: Is online sick leave legal?
items.answer: Yes, online sick leave certificates are fully legal and compliant with Polish law. Consultations are conducted by licensed doctors with the right to practice. E-sick leave is accepted by ZUS and employers on the same terms as traditional certificates.

items.question: How quickly will I receive my sick leave certificate?
items.answer: You can receive your certificate within 30 minutes of completing the consultation with the doctor. E-sick leave is automatically sent to ZUS and your employer, so you don't have to handle anything additionally.

items.question: Will the doctor definitely issue me a certificate?
items.answer: The decision to issue a certificate is made by the doctor based on the medical consultation. The doctor must determine that your health condition justifies temporary inability to work. This is not a service that guarantees automatic issuance of a certificate.

items.question: For how many days can I get online sick leave?
items.answer: E-sick leave can be issued for a period of up to 7 days. The start date can be a maximum of 3 days before the consultation date. If a longer leave is needed, the doctor may recommend an in-person visit.

items.question: Is my data secure?
items.answer: Yes, we fully comply with GDPR regulations. All data is encrypted, stored on secure servers, and accessible only to authorized persons. We never share your medical data with third parties without your consent.

items.question: What does the process of obtaining sick leave look like?
items.answer: The process consists of three simple steps: 1) Fill out the online medical form (5 minutes), 2) The doctor will conduct a phone consultation, 3) You'll receive e-sick leave that automatically goes to ZUS and your employer. The whole process takes a maximum of 30 minutes.

items.question: Can I get sick leave to care for a child?
items.answer: Yes, we also offer sick leave for caring for a sick family member. In the form, you need to provide the sick person's data and employer information. The doctor will assess the situation and decide on issuing a caregiver's leave.

items.question: What if I'm a student?
items.answer: Students can also use our service. In this case, the certificate is not sent to an employer, but you receive a PDF document that you can present at your school or university.
